contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox MP |honorific-prefix = |name = Gerry Bermingham |honorific-suffix = |image = |constituency_MP = [[St Helens South (UK Parliament constituency)|St Helens South]] |parliament = |majority = |term_start = 9 June 1983 |term_end = 7 June 2001 |predecessor = [[Boundary Commissions (United Kingdom)|Constituency Established]] |successor = [[Shaun Woodward]] |birth_date = {{birth date and age|1940|08|20|df=yes}} |birth_place = [[Dublin]], [[Ireland]] |death_date = |death_place = |restingplace = |birthname = |nationality = |party = [[Labour Party (UK)|Labour]] |otherparty = |spouse = |relations = |children = |residence = |alma_mater = [[University of Sheffield]] |occupation = |profession = |cabinet = |committees = |portfolio = |religion = |signature = |website = }} '''Gerald Edward Bermingham''' is a [[United Kingdom|British]] politician, and was [[Labour Party (UK)|Labour]] [[Member of Parliament]] for [[St Helens South (UK Parliament constituency)|St Helens South]] from 1983 until 2001.<ref name=stich>{{cite web| url = http://news.bbc.co.uk/news/vote2001/hi/english/newsid_1327000/1327507.stm | title = Safe seat 'stitch-up' | accessdate = 2010-12-05 | date = 2001-05-13 | publisher = ''[[BBC News Online]]''}}</ref> He was born 20 August 1940 in [[Dublin]], [[Ireland]], and educated at Cotton College, Wellingborough Grammar School and [[Sheffield University]], where he obtained a degree in law. He was admitted as a solicitor in 1967, and was called to the Bar ([[Gray's Inn]]) in 1985. He was a [[Sheffield]] City councillor from 1975 to 1979. He contested South East Derbyshire in 1979. In 1994, he was one of six Labour MPs who voted against any reduction in the age of consent for homosexuals, even to 18 (at the time, the age of consent was 21).<ref name=opposed>{{cite news | first = David | last = Mckie | title = Four in 10 Conservatives opposed change | publisher = [[The Guardian]] | date = 1994-02-23 | accessdate = 2010-12-05}}</ref> On his retirement, he was succeeded by [[Shaun Woodward]], a [[Conservative Party (UK)|Conservative]] defector, who swapped his old seat of [[Witney (UK Parliament constituency)|Witney]] to represent the ultra-safe St Helens South.<ref name=labour>{{cite web| url = http://news.bbc.co.uk/news/vote2001/hi/english/newsid_1329000/1329410.stm | title = 'I'm Labour man now' - Woodward | accessdate = 2010-12-05 | date = 2001-05-14 | publisher = ''[[BBC News Online]]''}}</ref> ==References== {{reflist}} {{s-start}} {{s-par|uk}} {{succession box | title = [[Member of Parliament]] for [[St Helens South (UK Parliament constituency)|St Helens South]] | years = [[United Kingdom general election, 1983|1983]]–[[United Kingdom general election, 2001|2001]] | before = ''(New constituency)'' | after = [[Shaun Woodward]] }} {{s-end}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Bermingham, Gerry | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = British politician | DATE OF BIRTH =20 August 1940 | PLACE OF BIRTH =[[Dublin]], [[Ireland]] | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Bermingham, Gerry}} [[Category:1940 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Alumni of the University of Sheffield]] [[Category:Members of the United Kingdom Parliament for English constituencies]] [[Category:Labour Party (UK) MPs]] [[Category:UK MPs 1983–1987]] [[Category:UK MPs 1987–1992]] [[Category:UK MPs 1992–1997]] [[Category:UK MPs 1997–2001]] {{Labour-UK-MP-stub}} {{England-politician-stub}}
